subject: Programming
title: User Stories and Backlogs
description: A quick win: understand User Stories and Backlogs.

hook.text: Instead of 500-page requirement docs, agile teams write stories on index cards. Short and human.

buildup.text: A user story follows a template: as a user, I want X, so that Y. It captures need, not solution.

discovery.text: Stories are conversation starters, not contracts. The detail emerges through discussion.

twist.text: Teams sometimes write stories so vague they're useless, or so detailed they're mini specifications.

climax.text: A good backlog is a living list of priorities, not a wishlist. It changes as learning happens.

punchline.text: Capture the need, not the solution.

quiz.question: What format do user stories follow?
options: As a user, I want X, so that Y
